item.description:
Calling all public radio lovers, especially This American Life (TAL) fans. Things you can't do on the radio let's you to be witness to a live taping of TAL beamed live from New York. Watch as live versions of the show's in depth stories are performed before an audience in addition to other goodness like musical performances, surprise guests and short films.

If you're a fan of the radio show, this should make for a great experience.

Showcase Cinemas in Warwick will be broadcasting the show. Tickets cost $20 and can be bought online (www.fathomevents.com) or at the venue. Not bad if you consider you're supporting public broadcasting. All in all, not a bad night.

 

For more information:

http://www.thisamericanlife.org/cinema

 

For ticketing info (if you decide to buy online):

http://www.fathomevents.com/originals/event/thisamericanlife2012.aspx

Make sure to get tickets for the Warwick Cinema venue.

I'm buying online to make sure I don't have to deal with a sellout.

See you there
item.how_to_find_us: Lets meet in the lobby a few minutes before showtime
item.name: This American Life: Live (Things you can't do on the radio)
